iti88:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti88:2.1: “Mendicants, there are these three inner stains, inner foes, inner enemies, inner killers, and inner adversaries.
iti88:2.6: These three are inner stains, inner foes, inner enemies, inner killers, and inner adversaries.”
iti88:2.7: That is what the Buddha said.
iti88:4.1: A greedy person doesn’t know the good.
iti88:4.2: A greedy person doesn’t see the truth.
iti88:4.3: When a person is beset by greed,
iti88:5.1: Those who have given up greed,
iti88:5.2: don’t get greedy even when provoked.
iti88:5.4: like a drop from a lotus-leaf.
iti88:7.1: A hateful person doesn’t know the good.
iti88:7.2: A hateful person doesn’t see the truth.
iti88:7.3: When a person is beset by hate,
iti88:8.1: Those who have given up hate,
iti88:8.2: don’t get angry even when provoked.
iti88:8.4: like a palm-leaf from its stem.
iti88:10.1: A deluded person doesn’t know the good.
iti88:10.2: A deluded person doesn’t see the truth.
iti88:10.3: When a person is beset by delusion,
iti88:11.1: Those who have given up delusion,
iti88:11.2: don’t get deluded even when provoked.
iti88:11.4: as the rising sun the dark.”
iti88:12.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
